The character will be saved to your char: The character will be saved to your characters/ folder with this base filename.
The preset will be saved to your presets: The preset will be saved to your presets/ folder with this base filename.
How can I help you today?: How can I help you today?
Defines how the chat prompt is generated: Defines how the chat prompt is generated. In instruct and chat-instruct modes, the instruction template Parameters > Instruction template is used.
<|character|> and <|prompt|> get replace: <|character|> and <|prompt|> get replaced with the bot name and the regular chat prompt respectively.
Get token IDs for the input: Get token IDs for the input
Set to greater than 0 to enable DRY. Rec: Set to greater than 0 to enable DRY. Recommended value: 0.8.
Longest sequence that can be repeated wi: Longest sequence that can be repeated without being penalized.
Controls how fast the penalty grows with: Controls how fast the penalty grows with increasing sequence length.
Tokens across which sequence matching is: Tokens across which sequence matching is not continued. Specified as a comma-separated list of quoted strings.
Expand max_new_tokens to the available c: Expand max_new_tokens to the available context length.
Forces the model to never end the genera: Forces the model to never end the generation prematurely.
Disabling this can make the replies more: Disabling this can make the replies more creative.
Add the bos_token to the beginning of pr: Add the bos_token to the beginning of prompts
Written between \"\" and separated by co: Written between "" and separated by commas.
Token IDs to ban, separated by commas. T: Token IDs to ban, separated by commas. The IDs can be found in the Default or Notebook tab.
For Contrastive Search. do_sample must b: For Contrastive Search. do_sample must be unchecked.
For CFG. 1.5 is a good value.
Adjusts the dropoff curve of Quadratic S: Adjusts the dropoff curve of Quadratic Sampling.
Moves temperature/dynamic temperature/qu: Moves temperature/dynamic temperature/quadratic sampling to the end of the sampler stack, ignoring their positions in "Sampler priority".
Parameter names separated by new lines o: Parameter names separated by new lines or commas.
Truncate the prompt up to this length: Truncate the prompt up to this length
The leftmost tokens are removed if the p: The leftmost tokens are removed if the prompt exceeds this length. Most models require this to be at most 2048.
To make text readable in real time.
Set this if you experience lag in the UI: Set this if you experience lag in the UI during streaming.
Some specific models need this unset.
Used in chat and chat-instruct modes.
Name: Name
Here you can optionally write a descript: Here you can optionally write a description of yourself.
After selecting the template, click on \: After selecting the template, click on "Load" to load and apply it.
If not empty, will be used instead of th: If not empty, will be used instead of the default one.
Change this according to the model/LoRA: Change this according to the model/LoRA that you are using. Used in instruct and chat-instruct modes.
Must be set to more than 0 for your GPU: Must be set to more than 0 for your GPU to be used.
Context length. Try lowering this if you: Context length. Try lowering this if you run out of memory while loading the model.
List of proportions to split the model a: List of proportions to split the model across multiple GPUs. Example: 60,40
Comma-separated list of VRAM (in GB) to: Comma-separated list of VRAM (in GB) to use per GPU. Example: 20,7,7
Positional embeddings alpha factor for N: Positional embeddings alpha factor for NTK RoPE scaling. Recommended values (NTKv1): 1.75 for 1.5x context, 2.5 for 2x context. Use either this or compress_pos_emb, not both.
Positional embeddings frequency base for: Positional embeddings frequency base for NTK RoPE scaling. Related to alpha_value by rope_freq_base = 10000 * alpha_value ^ (64 / 63). 0 = from model.
Positional embeddings compression factor: Positional embeddings compression factor. Should be set to (context length) / (model's original context length). Equal to 1/rope_freq_scale.
ExLlamav2_HF is recommended over AutoGPT: ExLlamav2_HF is recommended over AutoGPTQ for models derived from Llama.
Set use_flash_attention_2=True while loa: Set use_flash_attention_2=True while loading the model.
Set attn_implementation= eager while loa: Set attn_implementation= eager while loading the model.
NVIDIA only: use llama-cpp-python compil: NVIDIA only: use llama-cpp-python compiled with tensor cores support. This may increase performance on newer cards.
Use Q4 cache to save VRAM.
(experimental) Activate StreamingLLM to: (experimental) Activate StreamingLLM to avoid re-evaluating the entire prompt when old messages are removed.
StreamingLLM: number of sink tokens. Onl: StreamingLLM: number of sink tokens. Only used if the trimmed prompt doesn't share a prefix with the old prompt.
llama.cpp: Use llama-cpp-python compiled: llama.cpp: Use llama-cpp-python compiled without GPU acceleration. Transformers: use PyTorch in CPU mode.
Split the model by rows across GPUs. Thi: Split the model by rows across GPUs. This may improve multi-gpu performance.
Do not offload the  K, Q, V to the GPU. This saves VRAM but reduces the performance.
Affects Triton only. Disable fused MLP. Fused MLP improves performance but uses more VRAM. Disable if running low on VRAM.
This can make models faster on some syst: This can make models faster on some systems.
'desc_act', 'wbits', and 'groupsize' are: 'desc_act', 'wbits', and 'groupsize' are used for old models without a quantize_config.json.
NUMA support can help on some systems wi: NUMA support can help on some systems with non-uniform memory access.
Automatically split the model tensors ac: Automatically split the model tensors across the available GPUs.
Necessary to use CFG with this loader.
Enable inference with ModelRunnerCpp, wh: Enable inference with ModelRunnerCpp, which is faster than the default ModelRunner.
Only applies to MoE models like Mixtral.
Set trust_remote_code=True while loading: Set trust_remote_code=True while loading the tokenizer/model. To enable this option, start the web UI with the --trust-remote-code flag.
Set use_fast=False while loading the tok: Set use_fast=False while loading the tokenizer.
Needs to be set for perplexity evaluatio: Needs to be set for perplexity evaluation to work with this loader. Otherwise, ignore it, as it makes prompt processing slower.
Disable ExLlama kernel for GPTQ models.
Disable ExLlamav2 kernel for GPTQ models: Disable ExLlamav2 kernel for GPTQ models.
ExLlamav2_HF is recommended over ExLlama: ExLlamav2_HF is recommended over ExLlamav2 for better integration with extensions and more consistent sampling behavior across loaders.
llamacpp_HF loads llama.cpp as a Transfo: llamacpp_HF loads llama.cpp as a Transformers model. To use it, you need to place your GGUF in a subfolder of models/ with the necessary tokenizer files.
You can use the \"llamacpp_HF creator\": You can use the "llamacpp_HF creator" menu to do that automatically.
TensorRT-LLM has to be installed manuall: TensorRT-LLM has to be installed manually in a separate Python 3.10 environment at the moment. For a guide, consult the description of
does not support streaming at the moment: does not support streaming at the moment.
Whether to load the model as soon as it: Whether to load the model as soon as it is selected in the Model dropdown.
Enter the Hugging Face username/model pa: Enter the Hugging Face username/model path, for instance: facebook/galactica-125m. To specify a branch, add it at the end after a ":" character like this: facebook/galactica-125m:main. To download a single file, enter its name in the second box.
Enter the URL for the original (unquanti: Enter the URL for the original (unquantized) model
This will move your gguf file into a sub: This will move your gguf file into a subfolder of
along with the necessary tokenizer files: along with the necessary tokenizer files.
This allows you to set a customized temp: This allows you to set a customized template for the model currently selected in the "Model loader" menu. Whenever the model gets loaded, this template will be used in place of the template specified in the model's medatada, which sometimes is wrong.
The name of your new LoRA file: The name of your new LoRA file
If the name is the same, checking will r: If the name is the same, checking will replace the existing file, and unchecking will load and continue from it (the rank must be the same).
Selects which modules to target in train:
Selects which modules to target in training. Targeting more modules is closer to a full fine-tune at the cost of increased VRAM requirements and adapter size.
NOTE: Only works for model_id='llama', other types will retain default training behavior and not use these settings.
Also called dimension count. Higher valu: Also called dimension count. Higher values = larger file, more content control. Smaller values = smaller file, less control. Use 4 or 8 for style, 128 or 256 to teach, 1024+ for fine-detail on big data. More VRAM is needed for higher ranks.
This divided by the rank becomes the sca: This divided by the rank becomes the scaling of the LoRA. Higher means stronger. A good standard value is twice your Rank.
Global batch size. The two batch sizes t: Global batch size. The two batch sizes together determine gradient accumulation (gradientAccum = batch / microBatch). Higher gradient accum values lead to better quality training.
Per-device batch size (NOTE: multiple de: Per-device batch size (NOTE: multiple devices not yet implemented). Increasing this will increase VRAM usage.
Cutoff length for text input. Essentiall: Cutoff length for text input. Essentially, how long of a line of text to feed in at a time. Higher values require drastically more VRAM.
If above 0, a checkpoint of the LoRA wil: If above 0, a checkpoint of the LoRA will be saved every time this many steps pass.
Number of times every entry in the datas: Number of times every entry in the dataset should be fed into training. So 1 means feed each item in once, 5 means feed it in five times, etc.
In scientific notation. 3e-4 is a good s: In scientific notation. 3e-4 is a good starting base point. 1e-2 is extremely high, 1e-6 is extremely low.
Learning rate scheduler - defines how th: Learning rate scheduler - defines how the learning rate changes over time. "Constant" means never change, "linear" means to go in a straight line from the learning rate down to 0, cosine follows a curve, etc.
Percentage probability for dropout of Lo: Percentage probability for dropout of LoRA layers. This can help reduce overfitting. Most users should leave at default.
The process will automatically stop once: The process will automatically stop once the desired loss value is reached. (reasonable numbers are 1.5-1.8)
Different optimizer implementation optio: Different optimizer implementation options, for advanced users. Effects of different options are not well documented yet.
For this many steps at the start, the le: For this many steps at the start, the learning rate will be lower than normal. This helps the trainer prepare the model and precompute statistics to improve the quality of training after the start.
Only consider text *after* this string i: Only consider text *after* this string in any given chunk for training. For Alpaca datasets, use "### Response:" to only train the response and ignore the input.
Adds EOS token for each dataset item. In: Adds EOS token for each dataset item. In case of raw text, the EOS will be added at the Hard Cut
If checked, changes Rank/Alpha slider ab: If checked, changes Rank/Alpha slider above to go much higher. This will not work without a datacenter-class GPU.
The format file used to decide how to fo: The format file used to decide how to format the dataset input.
The dataset file to use for training.
The (optional) dataset file used to eval: The (optional) dataset file used to evaluate the model after training.
If an evaluation dataset is given, test: If an evaluation dataset is given, test it every time this many steps pass.
The raw text file to use for training.
How many tokens from the prior chunk of: How many tokens from the prior chunk of text to include into the next chunk. (The chunks themselves will be of a size determined by Cutoff Length). Setting overlap to exactly half the cutoff length may be ideal.
Length (in characters, not tokens) of th: Length (in characters, not tokens) of the maximum distance to shift an overlap cut by to ensure chunks cut at newlines. If too low, cuts may occur in the middle of lines.
String that indicates a hard cut between: String that indicates a hard cut between text parts. Helps prevent unwanted overlap.
Ignore Hard Cut blocks that have less or: Ignore Hard Cut blocks that have less or equal characters than this number
The raw text file on which the model wil: The raw text file on which the model will be evaluated. The first options are automatically downloaded: wikitext, ptb, and ptb_new. The next options are your local text files under training/datasets.
Used to make the evaluation faster at th: Used to make the evaluation faster at the cost of accuracy. 1 = slowest but most accurate. 512 is a common value.
The context for each evaluation. If set: The context for each evaluation. If set to 0, the maximum context length for the model will be used.
Note that some of these extensions may r: Note that some of these extensions may require manually installing Python requirements through the command: pip install -r extensions/extension_name/requirements.txt
